snippets: Clarithromycin is a strong inhibitor of CYP3A4. Concomitant use with simvastatin greatly increases simvastatin plasma levels and risk of myopathy or rhabdomyolysis. The combination is contraindicated. (BNF Interactions, accessed 20 Jun 2025)

If a macrolide is essential, withhold simvastatin during treatment or switch to a statin not metabolised by CYP3A4, such as pravastatin. Resume simvastatin three days after final clarithromycin dose. (NICE NG215 Lipid modification, 2024)
